meanings.definition: To remove from a seat or position of authority.
meanings.sent1: The teacher disseated the student from the front row.
meanings.sent2: The king disseated the traitorous advisor from the royal council.
meanings.sent3: The cat disseated the sleeping dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm disseated the leaves from the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The referee disseated the player from the game for unsportsmanlike conduct.

meanings.sent1: The rebels sought to disseated the corrupt ruler from power.
meanings.sent2: The election results will disseated the incumbent mayor.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick disseated the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent4: The sudden scandal disseated the CEO from his position of authority.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake disseated the fragile vase from its shelf.

meanings.definition: To dispossess or eject from a seat or position.
meanings.sent1: The landlord disseated the non-paying tenant from the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors voted to disseated the ineffective CEO.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind disseated the papers from the desk.
meanings.sent4: The new policy disseated the employees from their comfort zone.
meanings.sent5: The eviction notice disseated the family from their home.
